page.title: 05CROPPING IN N-E LEICS.
page.content: The main crops grown in this mixed farming area are; {CASH CROPS-} wheat, barley, oats, and oil seed rape. {FODDER CROPS}-sown and fertilised grass land for use as hay or silage. {Hay and silage production. As part of the management of a mixed farm , grassland is ploughed and sown regularly to provide winter feed for the livestock.It is treated with fertilisers, both natural and chemical This may be stored in dry form as{HAY in Dutch Barns or in wet form as {SILAGE}in pits or clamps.The grass is stored so as to exclude air by covering it with polythene sheeting.In recent years there has been a trend towards the increased production of silage at the expense of hay.Farmers have been encouraged to grow special varieties of grass suitable for silage
